events.originalText: The NASA space probe Voyager 1 became the first man-made object to enter interstellar space.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Voyager 1 Enters Interstellar Space

events.originalText: Mexican drug war: Fifty-two people are killed in an arson at a casino in Monterrey, Mexico.
events.subtitle: Mexican drug war
events.headline: 52 Killed in Arson Attack at Casino in Monterrey, Mexico

events.originalText: American singer Aaliyah (pictured) and several members of her record company were killed when their overloaded aircraft crashed shortly after taking off from Marsh Harbour Airport in the Bahamas.
events.subtitle: Aaliyah
events.headline: Aaliyah Killed in Plane Crash in the Bahamas

events.originalText: The NASA spacecraft Voyager 2 made its closest approach to Neptune and provided definitive proof of the existence of the planet's rings (pictured).
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Voyager 2 Confirms Neptune's Rings

events.originalText: Bruce Springsteen released his commercial breakthrough album, Born to Run.
events.subtitle: Bruce Springsteen
events.headline: Bruce Springsteen Releases Born to Run Album

events.originalText: World War II: Japanese forces attacked the Australian base at Milne Bay on the eastern tip of New Guinea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese Forces Attack Australian Base at Milne Bay

events.originalText: Matthew Webb became the first person to swim across the English Channel, doing so in approximately 21 hours 40 minutes.
events.subtitle: Matthew Webb
events.headline: Matthew Webb First to Swim Across English Channel

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: Prussian forces engaged the Russians at the Battle of Zorndorf in present-day Sarbinowo, Poland.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War
events.headline: Prussian Forces Battle Russians at Zorndorf

events.originalText: The Honourable Artillery Company, now the oldest surviving regiment in the British Army, was granted a royal charter by Henry VIII.
events.subtitle: Honourable Artillery Company
events.headline: Honourable Artillery Company Granted Royal Charter by Henry VIII

events.originalText: Philip III became King of France following the death of his father Louis IX during the Eighth Crusade.
events.subtitle: Philip III of France
events.headline: Philip III Becomes King of France

events.originalText: George Mouzalon, the regent of the Empire of Nicaea, was assassinated as part of a conspiracy led by nobles under the future emperor Michael VIII Palaiologos.
events.subtitle: George Mouzalon
events.headline: Regent of Nicaea Assassinated in Conspiracy

events.originalText: Genghis Khan, founder of the Mongol Empire, died after a lengthy illness during the Mongol conquest of Western Xia.
events.subtitle: Genghis Khan
events.headline: Genghis Khan Dies During Mongol Conquest of Western Xia
